intro: Parabaena heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf parabaena, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its variable leaf morphology, which can range from narrow to broad and even lobed. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, white or pinkish flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the spring and summer months. Parabaena heterophylla is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
